CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)</t><stat>select id, role_id from user_roles</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))</t><stat>SELECT users.id, users.username, roles.role_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))</t><stat>SELECT users.username, COUNT(user_roles.role_id) FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.id GROUP BY users.username HAVING COUNT(user_roles.role_id) > 1</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))</t><stat>select users.username, count(user_roles.role_id) from users join user_roles on users.id = user_roles.id group by users.username having count(user_roles.role_id) > 1</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)</t><stat>SELECT users.username, COUNT(user_roles.role_id) FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.id GROUP BY users.username HAVING COUNT(user_roles.role_id) > 1</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)</t><stat>SELECT users.username, COUNT(users.username) FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.id = user_roles.id GROUP BY users.username HAVING COUNT(users.username) > 1</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))

CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, password VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE permissions (permission_id INT PRIMARY KEY, permission_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)

CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL)</t><stat>select users.username, count(users.username) from users join user_roles on users.id = user_roles.id group by users.username having count(users.username) > 1</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE user_roles (id INT, role_id INT, FOREIGN KEY (id) REFERENCES users (id), FOREIGN KEY (role_id) REFERENCES roles (role_id))

    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    role_id UUID,

    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)

    permission_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);</t><stat>SELECT user_id, username FROM users;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE users (

    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

    role_name STRING
);

    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    permission_id UUID,

);

    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)

    permission_name STRING
);

    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    role_name STRING
);

    role_name STRING
);

    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

    user_id UUID,

    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)

    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT * FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT * FROM roles JOIN user_roles ON roles.role_id = user_roles.role_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,

);

    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,

);

    role_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT * FROM roles JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);</t><stat>select * from roles join permissions on roles.role_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE roles (

);

    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    user_id UUID,

    user_id UUID,

    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

    username STRING,
    password STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT * FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    role_name STRING
);

    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)

    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,

    password STRING
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,

    password STRING

    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING

    username STRING,
    password STRING
);</t><stat>select users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name from users join user_roles on users.user_id = user_roles.user_id join roles on user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id join role_permissions on roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id join permissions on role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);</t><stat>SELECT users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,

    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);</t><stat>SELECT users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

CREATE TABLE permissions (
    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);

    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);</t><stat>select users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name from users join user_roles on users.user_id = user_roles.user_id join roles on user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id join role_permissions on roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id join permissions on role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,

    permission_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    permission_name STRING
);</t><stat>SELECT users.user_id, roles.role_name, permissions.permission_name FROM users JOIN user_roles ON users.user_id = user_roles.user_id JOIN roles ON user_roles.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN role_permissions ON roles.role_id = role_permissions.role_id JOIN permissions ON role_permissions.permission_id = permissions.permission_id;</stat><divider><t>CREATE TABLE role_permissions (
    role_id UUID,
    permission_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (role_id, permission_id)
);

CREATE TABLE user_roles (
    user_id UUID,
    role_id UUID,
    PRIMARY KEY (user_id, role_id)
);

CREATE TABLE roles (
    role_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    role_name STRING
);

    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username STRING,
    password STRING
);

    permission_name STRING
